[1] Expression of Adenylate Cyclase and Phosphodiesterase Isoforms in MIN6 Cellsâ€”To identify the AC and PDE isoforms involved in the regulation of Ca2+-dependent cAMP signals in MIN6 Î²-cells, we used reverse transcription-PCR. [2] We detected transcripts for Ca2+-activated AC-I and AC-VIII isoforms as well as AC-IV-VII and AC-IX (see supplemental Fig. S1). [1] The plasticity and diversity of cellular signals elicited by extracellular stimuli are determined by information encoded in specific patterns of spatial and temporal changes in Ca2+ and cAMP concentrations.

llm_generation.summary: In this context, adenosine 5'-monophosphate (AMP) is indirectly related to regulation through its involvement in the signaling pathways of MIN6 β-cells. The study focuses on the expression of adenylate cyclase (AC) and phosphodiesterase (PDE) isoforms that modulate cAMP levels, which are crucial for cellular responses to stimuli. While AMP itself is not explicitly discussed, its role as a signaling molecule in regulating cAMP concentrations is implied, highlighting its importance in the broader regulatory mechanisms of cellular signaling.
